botAction.you_can_link_a_virtual_assistant: You can link a Virtual Assistant built on the Kore.ai Platform with your SearchAssist app. To link, you will need to enable the Webhook channel on the Virtual Assistant and complete the integration.

botAction.enable_webhook_channel_for_your: Enable Webhook channel for your Virtual Assistant using the Access Token & Post URL provided below.
botAction.please_subscribe_to_the_kore: Please subscribe to the Kore.ai bots platform to link a bot here
botAction.choose_any_bot_from_the_list: Choose any bot from the list to link it to your SearchAssist app.

addFaq.contact_details_info: It is extremely important that you keep your contact information on your account updated at all times. To update your address, phone numbers and email address, please login to your account and edit your contact details under the “Your Contact Details” link on the left navigation. To make changes to your account, you will also need to enter an Online Authorization Code (OAC) that will be sent to your registered mobile phone on your account and to your registered email address to authenticate this transaction.

traits.traits_are_specific_entities: Traits are specific entities, attributes or details that the users express in their conversations.  Traits present in the utterance can be used in driving the intent detection and bot conversation flows. SearchAssist allows you to define Traits and train the utterances.

searchexperience.click_on_searchbox: Click on search box to customize border and fill color
searchexperience.click_search_icon: Click on search icon to change the icon as per your choice
searchexperience.click_on_text: Click on the text to customize text content and color
searchexperience.click_on_button: Click on the button to customize button text, fill color and border color
searchexperience.recommended_file_size: Recommended icon size : 26X26 pixels, less than 5 kb
searchexperience.not_sure: Not Sure! What you can do with these interaction settings?
searchexperience.it_is_recommended: It is recommended to go through this guide before customizing interactions.
searchexperience.to_enable_the_user: to enable the user to see their Frequently or recently searched queries. These queries will appear as cards in the search window as soon as the user puts their cursor in the search bar
searchexperience.saves_the_time: Saves the time and effort for the users by predicting the rest of the word as the user is typing
searchexperience.reduces_users_time: reduces user’s time to search a query by providing suggestions which help users to enter long queries or select a query as they type.
searchexperience.enhances_users: enhances user’s search experience by showing the results while entering the query and allows the user to see search results without needing to redirect to the results page
searchexperience.when_both_are_enabled: when both are enabled the live search results appear at the background of the query suggestions and the user can scroll to browse the results.

useronboarding.You_havent_configured: You haven’t configured your app yet!
useronboarding.searchAssist_allows_you: SearchAssist allows you to add different types of data such as FAQs, Actions, Content, Structured Data from various sources.
useronboarding.searchAssist_allows_you_index: SearchAssist allows you to Index the data that you want to make searchable.
useronboarding.SearchAssist_allows_to_optimize: SearchAssist allows to optimize the search results through Synonyms, Weights, Stop Words, Rules, Facets.
useronboarding.searchAssist_allows_you_to_customize: SearchAssist allows you to customize the search experience and design the search interface based on the business context.
useronboarding.searchAssist_allows_you_to_validate: SearchAssist allows you to validate the configuration and search experience before deploying the app by just clicking on the Test button.
useronboarding.searchAssist_Allows_you_to_fine_tune: SearchAssist Allows you to fine-tune search results further with the result ranking actions such as pinning, boosting, lowering and hiding.
useronboarding.i_want_to_Explore: I want to Explore by Myself

header.emptyStatusRecords: You got no records in StatusDocker.
